intro: Gnaphalopsis, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family. These plants are characterized by their silver-gray foliage and fluffy, dandelion-like seed heads. They are native to regions of southern Africa and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. Gnaphalopsis species are known for their ability to thrive in arid environments due to their succulent leaves and deep root systems. The flowers are typically yellow and bloom in late spring or early summer.
